snippet: Despite evidence of frail health, Abdelaziz Bouteflika, 77, insisted on running again, a move that has united both secular and Islamic parties in their call to boycott the election.
abstract: Re-election of incumbent Algerian Pres Abdelaziz Bouteflika appears inevitable; he has already been in power 15 years; despite evidence of frail health, he insisted on running again at age 77, move that has united both secular and Islamic parties in their call to boycott the election.

byline.original: By AMIR JALAL ZERDOUMI and CARLOTTA GALL
byline.contributor: Amir Jalal Zerdoumi reported from Algiers, and Carlotta Gall from New York.

lead_paragraph: Despite evidence of frail health, Abdelaziz Bouteflika, 77, insisted on running again, a move that has united both secular and Islamic parties in their call to boycott the election.

headline.main: Discontent Swells as President of Algeria Seeks a Fourth Term
headline.print_headline: Discontent Swells as President of Algeria Seeks a Fourth Term

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
